generalInfo:
Madagascar to Zanzibar – An Indian Ocean Expedition

850+ Nautical Miles | Offshore Passage | Island-Hopping Adventure

Departing Nosy Be, we glide south to Russian Bay, where fishermen may paddle out with fresh lobster—an unforgettable welcome to Madagascar’s wild and generous coast. A short hop to the picture-perfect Nosy Iranja sets the stage for our 850-nautical-mile downwind run across the Indian Ocean.
With a strong east–west current and steady broad-reach winds, this is fast, exhilarating sailing. Billfish strike in the wake, drawn to the rush of the current, and seabirds wheel across endless skies. If conditions allow, we may extend our course to the remote Aldabra Atoll, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the world’s most pristine marine sanctuaries.

Skirting north of Mayotte and the Comoros Islands, we make landfall on the African coast at Mtwara, tucking into the sheltered bay of Mikindani. Here you can explore Livingstone’s House before continuing along a coastline of dramatic drop-offs, where the seabed plunges from 10 to 600 metres just offshore.
From there, we island-hop northwards: tranquil anchorages, vibrant fishing villages, and the chance to swim with whale sharks off Mafia Island. Finally, we close the circle of this 1,800-nautical-mile odyssey with a triumphant landfall in storied Zanzibar—the spice island where history, culture, and golden beaches converge.

What Kind of Sailing to Expect
Warm trade-wind sailing with fast downwind, down-current conditions (currents of 2–3 knots possible)
Mostly broad-reaching, making for comfortable, exhilarating passage-making
As we head north toward Zanzibar, we hug the coast to stay sheltered from opposing currents
A mix of bluewater sailing and relaxed coastal island-hopping with plenty of opportunities to go ashore

Your Vessel: Synergy
Sail aboard Synergy, our comfortable and well-equipped 40ft Fontaine Pajot catamaran.
Small group voyage – perfect for solo travellers, couples, or friends
Professional Skipper and First Mate for safety and coaching
Spacious cabins (double or twin), one shared bathroom per hull
Snorkelling gear and tender for shore exploration
Bedding provided – comfort prioritised

What’s Included
All onboard meals and snacks
Snorkelling equipment and tender for shore trips
Bedding and comfortable accommodation onboard
Sailing tuition and guidance from the crew

Not included: flights, transfers, visas, insurance, and meals/drinks ashore.
